stories.text:
My journey as an indie hacker or aspiring startup founder has been rocky to say the least. I'm aware that's nothing unusual. However, every now and then the path of taking a job pops up in my head.

I have never taken a job offer from a company before. I've only ever worked on my own projects. One of them got funded and went on to becoming a business but the subsequent projects only ever reached pre product market fit. Still, I have experience designing, building and distributing products. I have conducted hundreds of user interviews over the years and do think that I have a lot to offer.

How challenging will it be for me to gain credibility without a reputable organization or logo backing me?
stories.title: Ask HN: Solo makers who switched to a job, how difficult was it?
